executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Justin Randle and Bart Lamont from Dallas, Texas pitched Robin, a robotic lawn mowing service, seeking $500,000 for 5% equity on Shark Tank. The founders presented their environmentally friendly, subscription-based lawn care model using leased European robotic mowers, but all Sharks declined to invest due to high costs, slow ROI, and scalability concerns.
nextSteps: The founders plan to continue scaling their existing lawn care and robotic mowing business without Shark investment.
